summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors. The indictment alleges that from approximately 1994 to 1997, Maxwell conspired with Jeffrey Epstein to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls as young as 14, and that she committed perjury during a 2016 civil deposition.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor girls, with Maxwell assisting in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating access to victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the indictment as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Described as having a personal and professional relationship; intimate partners who conspired to entice and transport minors for sexual abuse.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties during the period of the alleged conspiracy.

events.title: Conspiracy to Abuse Minors
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls, including arranging for their travel across state and international lines.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused by Epstein at his New York residence.

events.title: Massage of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided an unsolicited massage to Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico, during which the victim was topless, as part of grooming for abuse by Epstein.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed and befriended Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to massage him, knowing it would lead to sexual abuse.

events.title: First Perjurious Deposition
events.description: During a civil deposition, Maxwell falsely testified that she was unaware of any scheme by Epstein to recruit underage girls for sexual massages and denied interacting with anyone under 18 at Epstein's properties other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Second Perjurious Deposition
events.description: Maxwell gave false testimony under oath, denying awareness of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house, denying knowledge of Epstein having sexual activities with others, and denying ever giving massages to anyone, including Epstein and Minor Victim-2.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with six federal counts: conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury.

The indictment alleges Maxwell played a central role in Epstein's abuse of minor girls from at least 1994 to 1997, including recruiting, grooming, and participating in sexual abuse of victims as young as 14.
Three specific minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, and -3) are described, with detailed allegations of grooming and abuse occurring in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and London.
Maxwell is accused of committing perjury during a 2016 civil deposition by denying knowledge of Epstein's scheme, denying interactions with underage girls, and denying giving massages.
The indictment states Maxwell and Epstein had an intimate relationship and that Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his properties during the period of the alleged conspiracy.
